title: Kitāb al-Qānūn fī al-ṭibb (The Canon of Medicine)
author: Ibn Sīnā (d. 1037)
description: The Qānūn of Ibn Sīnā  (Avicenna) represents the high point in the codification of Arabic medicine. It supplanted the works of Galen, al-Rāzī and al-Majūsī, and had an enormous influence on the teaching and practice of medicine. The Qānūn is divided into five books. Book I starts with a definition of medicine and then deals in a general fashion with the human body, sickness, health and therapeutics.
